page.title: 17AMBERLEY RAILWAY STATION
page.content: Amberley station was built in 1863. The Victorian buildings comprise a waiting room, ticket office, signal box and public conveniences. There are 2 platforms and 2 sets of track, with a bridge crossing from one platform to the other. There is a more modern waiting room on Platform 2. Trains leaving Platform 1 call at Little- hampton, Bognor Regis and Portsmouth. Trains leaving Platform 2 call at Horsham, Crawley, Gatwick Airport, Croydon and Victoria. Trains run every hour except for a break of 4 hours in the afternoon. The station is open from 6.40a.m. to 10.00p.m. There is only one man on duty at any time. There are 10 regular passengers using the station each day, only one of these being a commuter. Other passengers are tourists especially those visiting the Chalk Pits Museum.
